citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, the facility had two total active protocols pertaining to USDA covered species - one for the
guinea pigs, and one for the rabbits. Neither protocol included a rationale for involving animals or the for the
appropriateness of the species, which is important to ensure the procedures are appropriate for animal usage, the right
species is chosen, and therefore the avoidance of unnecessary discomfort and/or pain. A proposal to conduct an activity
involving animals, or to make a significant change in an ongoing activity involving animals, must contain a rationale for
involving animals, and for the appropriateness of the species and numbers of animals to be used.
Correct by: May 5, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.31(e)(2) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
At the time of the inspection, the facility had two total active protocols pertaining to USDA covered species - one for the 
guinea pigs, and one for the rabbits. Neither protocol included a rationale for involving animals or the for the 
appropriateness of the species, which is important to ensure the procedures are appropriate for animal usage, the right 
species is chosen, and therefore the avoidance of unnecessary discomfort and/or pain. A proposal to conduct an activity 
involving animals, or to make a significant change in an ongoing activity involving animals, must contain a rationale for 
involving animals, and for the appropriateness of the species and numbers of animals to be used. 
 
Correct by: May 5, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
